pullRequest.title: Issue/3571 delivery metrics
pullRequest.bodyText:
Scripts to capture the software delivery metrics.

Promote script will ask if the release is a hot fix and give instructions for the developer to run if the developer wants to proceed with the deploy.
Flip script will ask about the release to switch the live traffic to, guessing which one is the most likely.

Changes:

"Promote" tags will deploy to dark production.
"Flip" tags will flip the production traffic.
UAT1 deploys do not rebuild the binaries, but reuse the ones in UAT2.

All scripts can be tested as we are using dev2 as uat2, dev1 as uat1 and dev3 as akvoflow-23.
TODO:

Move flip and promote script to the docker images repo
Use the correct names for the different environments (dev1-> uat1, dev2->uat2, ...)
Agree on what is the best version to show in the Dashboard and which one in Clojars.
Agree on skip logic inside the scripts.

Part of #3571

commit.message:
[#3571] Use "flip-" and "promote-" tags

We keep the same flow/logic as before but we are going to change the tag names to match their meaning with what we do in other projects.

1. "promote-" tag will mean to deploy to dark production. It additionally will flip UAT1 to make it easy to access the new version, as right now to access a dark instance you need to guess a very big and per-version-specific url
1. "flip-" tags will flip the traffic to the new version.

Moving all the logic regarding which CI steps to run to Semaphore. The trade off is easier to understand what is CI running + no duplication vs no local testing + less portable scripts.

[#3571] Temporarily comment out deploys to avoid havoc

For testing
[#3571] Testing what happens if somebody click promote
[#3571] Temporarily deploy this branch to dev2
[#3571] Temporarily pretend dev1 is uat1 and dev2 is uat2
[#3571] Temporarily pretend dev1 is uat1 and dev2 is uat2
[#3571] Pretending dev3 is all other instances
[#3571] Flip tag does not need to be annotated

nodes.bodyText:
I've seen those pipe tricks elsewhere. If you want to continue working with text:
gcloud app versions list --project=akvoflow-uat1 --hide-no-traffic --service=default | awk '/^default/ {print $2}'
Or gcloud has --format=json for structured output
gcloud app versions list --project=akvoflow-uat1 --hide-no-traffic --service=default --format=json | jq -M -r '.[].version.id'

nodes.bodyText:
In promote-test-to-prod.sh line 72:
if [ "${FIX}" != "n" ] || [ "${FIX}" != "N" ]; then
                       ^-- SC2252: You probably wanted && here, otherwise it's always true.

For more information:
  https://www.shellcheck.net/wiki/SC2252 -- You probably wanted && here, othe...
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,85 @@
+#!/usr/bin/env bash
+
+set -u
+
+function log {
+   echo "$(date +"%T") - INFO - $*"
+}
+
+GITHUB_PROJECT=akvo-flow
+NOTIFICATION=${4:-slack}
+
+function read_version () {
+    CLUSTER=$1
+    log "Reading ${CLUSTER} version"
+    VERSION=$(gcloud app versions list --project="${CLUSTER}" --hide-no-traffic --service=default | grep "default" | tr -s " " | cut -f 2  -d\ )
+}
+
+if [[ -z "$(gcloud config list --format='value(core.account)')" ]]; then
+  gcloud auth login
+fi
+
+read_version "akvoflow-dev2"
+TEST_LIVE_VERSION=$VERSION
+
+read_version "akvoflow-dev1"
+PROD_DARK_VERSION=$VERSION
+
+read_version "akvoflow-dev3" # WHH instance
+PROD_LIVE_VERSION=$VERSION
+
+log "Deployed test version is $TEST_LIVE_VERSION"
+log "Deployed prod dark version is $PROD_DARK_VERSION"
+log "Diff between test and dark prod is https://github.com/akvo/${GITHUB_PROJECT}/compare/$PROD_DARK_VERSION..$TEST_LIVE_VERSION"
+
+if [[ "$PROD_DARK_VERSION" = "$PROD_LIVE_VERSION" ]]; then
+  log "Deployed prod live version is same as prod dark version"
+else
+  log "Deployed prod live version is $PROD_LIVE_VERSION"
+  log "Diff between test and live prod is https://github.com/akvo/${GITHUB_PROJECT}/compare/$PROD_LIVE_VERSION..$TEST_LIVE_VERSION"
+fi
+
+## Lets assume this git history:
+# v1 (prod-live)
+# v2
+# v3 (prod-dark)
+# v4
+# v5 (test)
+# When promoting a build, we want to report the new changes (v4, v5) that will show in dark.
+# But lets say that we have the previous history and we do a flip in production. We have:
+# v1 (prod-dark)
+# v2
+# v3 (prod-live)
+# v4
+# v5 (test)
+# So in this case we really want to report the changes between test and prod-live (still v4, v5)
+# In general terms, we want to see the diff between test and the last promotion.
+# Instead of looking at git tags, we just check which of the prod envs is older
+if git merge-base --is-ancestor "$PROD_LIVE_VERSION" "$PROD_DARK_VERSION"; then
+  NEWEST_VERSION_IN_PROD=$PROD_DARK_VERSION
+else
+  NEWEST_VERSION_IN_PROD=$PROD_LIVE_VERSION
+fi
+log "Commits to be deployed:"
+echo ""
+
+git log --oneline "$NEWEST_VERSION_IN_PROD".."$TEST_LIVE_VERSION" | grep -v "Merge pull request" | grep -v "Merge branch"
+
+TAG_NAME="promote-$(TZ=UTC date +"%Y%m%d-%H%M%S")"
+
+echo ""
+read -r -e -p "Does this deployment contain a hotfix, rollback or fix-forward for a previous deployment? [Y/n] " FIX
+if [ "${FIX}" != "n" ] || [ "${FIX}" != "N" ]; then

+FLOW_VERSION=${FLOW_VERSION:-${SEMAPHORE_GIT_SHA}}

commit.message:
[#3571] Use date+git_sha for Dashboard and Clojars version

Date gives a monotonically increasing number. This is for the users.

git sha gives a point in git. This is for developers.
[#3571] Using master branch instead of this branch
